unnormalised: The Ministry of Education has mandated the use of the APAAR ID for all students from pre-primary to higher education across India. This unique 12-digit ID, similar in structure to Aadhaar, aims to create a unified and accessible educational ecosystem. As per the official notification ref: ED/APAAR/2024/07/15, all institutions must comply before 31/12/2024.
normalised: The Ministry of Education has mandated the use of the A-P-A-A-R I-D for all students from pre-primary to higher education across India. This unique twelve-digit I-D, similar in structure to Aadhaar, aims to create a unified and accessible educational ecosystem. As per the official notification reference: E-D slash A-P-A-A-R slash two thousand and twenty four slash zero seven slash one five, all institutions must comply before thirty first December two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: The APAAR ID, also known as the Automated Permanent Academic Account Registry ID, will digitally store a student's academic journey, including exam results, scholarships received, and skills acquired. The notification clarifies that parental consent is required for students below 18 yrs of age. The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) and other state boards are working towards seamless integration with the APAAR system.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the Ministry of Labour and Employment is considering linking the APAAR ID with the National Career Service (NCS) portal. Sources within the ministry indicated this integration will streamline the job application process, allowing employers to verify academic credentials instantly. The official code for the Labour Ministry's initiative is NCS/APAAR/2025/02/28.

unnormalised: Experts believe this unified approach will enhance transparency and efficiency in the education and employment sectors. However, concerns remain regarding data privacy and security, particularly concerning the handling of sensitive student information under ID number format 1234-5678-9012. The government has assured robust measures to safeguard data and prevent misuse.
